projects.title: Sharp OSA (Open System Architecture)
projects.description: Enterprise-level SDKs and simulator maintenance for Sharp multifunction printers.
projects.details: I work on the Sharp OSA (Open System Architecture) team, maintaining legacy code and developing SDKs that allow third-party applications to interact with Sharp MFPs. My role involves ensuring the stability of the core architecture, maintaining sample applications for external developers, and modernizing internal tools. I recently migrated a Python-based GUI tool from Pyside2 to GTK4 to improve usability and maintainability.

projects.title: Cocoro Office (NAS Project)
projects.description: Backend services for device management and data synchronization in a cloud-based office solution.
projects.details: Cocoro Office is a cloud-based service providing office solutions, including NAS management. I contributed to the backend services responsible for device management and data synchronization. A key contribution was refactoring the HTTP client layer by replacing deprecated libraries with Axios, which enhanced security and code maintainability. I also worked on the frontend for MFP browsers, ensuring compatibility with older rendering engines using raw HTML and CSS.

projects.title: Emotion-Based Music Player
projects.description: Real-time facial expression detection system that plays music matching the user's mood.
projects.details: This academic project explores the intersection of Computer Vision and user experience. The system detects the user's facial expression in real-time using a webcam and plays music that matches their mood. It uses OpenCV for face detection and a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) trained on the FER-2013 dataset to classify emotions (Happy, Sad, Angry, Neutral, etc.) with 88% accuracy. The UI was built using Tkinter, and users can manage the playlist and even add custom emotions.
